info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 4 at 6:24PM CDT until April 9 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Nashville TN
info.description:
...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...
Cumberland River At Nashville affecting Davidson County.
For the Cumberland River...including Celina, OLD HICKORY DAM INFLOW FORECASTS, Penitentiary Branch, Carthage, Hunters Point, Edenwold, Hermitage, Pennington Bend, Omohundro Water Plant, Nashville, Bordeaux, Briley Pkwy At Cockrill Bend, Ashland City, Clarksville, Dover...elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Cumberland River at Nashville.
* WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Water reaches the second grassy area of the riverfront landing and covers most of the recreation areas on the east side of the river near Nissan Stadium.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 31.7 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will fall to 30.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then rise to 33.3 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will fall to 30.1 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then rise to 31.1 feet early Tuesday morning. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1230 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING
